Description: Small limestone stand or incense-burner; deep cup with mouldings supported on a narrow pedestal stand with a splaying foot, also moulded; traces of red paint on the the bowl and foot; part of the lip is missing.
Curator's comments: For comparable examples from Salamis, mostly of Roman date, see M.-J. Chavane 1975, 119-130 & pls. 36-37, esp. cat. no. 387. Bibliography: Chavane M.-J. 1975, Salamine de Chypre VI. Les petits objets (Paris).
